llm.feedback: Add explicit magnitude ranges to every line (e.g., “spx +2 % to +5 %”) and attach a single canonical handle (spx) to each driver; include a concrete catalyst window (e.g., “September 16‑17 FOMC”) and a causal chain citation for the magnitude (use IDs from the source); remove the second “Up” line because it duplicates the first’s Fed‑cut theme—replace it with a distinct upside scenario such as a 1 % Fed cut in September that lifts spx 3‑5 % (cite Z7O1DCHS7, FAN5RYW6T); for the two “Down” lines, give separate drivers (e.g., “Fed stays hawkish + tech earnings slowdown” and “Core PCE > 2.9 % + Fed hikes”) with distinct magnitude ranges (spx –5 % to –10 %) and distinct catalyst windows (e.g., “September 5 payrolls” vs. “August 30 PCE”); ensure each line ends with a single probability % and that all citations are inline. This will satisfy the handle‑mapping, catalyst‑window, and magnitude‑range requirements while eliminating redundancy.
